result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nicholas EJ Konrad

records.addlTxt: Defn is scheduled for an intake appointment with DPP on 8/30/2022

3:14 PM Prosecuting attorney Paul W. Humphrey in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Nicholas EJ Konrad in court.  Attorney Robert Brendan Hurley in court for Nicholas EJ Konrad.   Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Signed. Def entered a plea of guilty. Court accepted def's plea but w/h adjudication and referred def to FOP. Bail continued.
7/29 Status conference rescheduled due to Atty Hurley's availability.
Status conference on August 15, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Motion and Demand for Discovery and Notice of DNA and Witness List- State of Wisconsin
Status conference on July 29, 2022 at 09:15 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Nicholas EJ Konrad
Current: 811 County Rd MM, Oregon, WI 53575   (Effective: 05-02-2022)
Prior: 1062 Vinyard Dr, Oregon, WI 53575

Information was E-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defendant waived reading of Information; Defendant stood mute, Court enters plea of Not Guilty; motions due in 20 days; bail continued.

03:35 PM Defendant in court with Attorney Robert Brendan Hurley.  Cecilia E DeMarco appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Nicholas EJ Konrad appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant advised of right to and waived Preliminary Hearing (Preliminary Hearing Waiver signed); Court accepted waiver of Preliminary Hearing and ordered case bound over.

Status conference on May 2, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall report to the Dane County Jail to complete the booking/fingerprinting process within 10 days of today. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Nelson's Cards in Stoughton or any employee of Nelson's Cards. 
Parties stipulated to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing. 
Trial Judge - Br 13 

Defendant has acknowledged and agreed to terms and conditions of bond. Defendant must return signed bond form within 10 days of today. Any bail money previously posted will not be returned until a signed bond form is on file with the Clerk of Courts.

09:13 AM Defendant appeared.  Andrea Beth Raymond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties by Zoom. The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Status conference scheduled for May 2, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
